Uses of Interface
org.bson.BsonReader

  • Packages that use BsonReader 
    Package Description
    dev.morphia.geo  
    dev.morphia.mapping.codec  
    dev.morphia.mapping.codec.pojo  
    dev.morphia.mapping.codec.reader  
    dev.morphia.mapping.codec.references  
    dev.morphia.mapping.experimental  
    dev.morphia.query  
    org.bson
    Contains the base BSON classes.
    org.bson.codecs
    This package contains all the default BSON codecs.
    org.bson.codecs.jsr310
    This package contains classes specific to the JSR-310 Date and Time API
    org.bson.codecs.pojo
    This package contains classes specific to mapping user POJOs.
    org.bson.json
    JSON serialization and deserialization.

    • Uses of BsonReader in org.bson

      Classes in org.bson that implement BsonReader 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  AbstractBsonReader
      Abstract base class for BsonReader implementations.
      class  BsonBinaryReader
      A BsonReader implementation that reads from a binary stream of data.
      class  BsonDocumentReader
      A BsonReader implementation that reads from an instance of BsonDocument.
      Methods in org.bson that return BsonReader 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      BsonReader BsonDocument.asBsonReader()
      Gets the first value in the document
      Methods in org.bson with parameters of type BsonReader 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void AbstractBsonWriter.pipe​(BsonReader reader)  
      void AbstractBsonWriter.pipe​(BsonReader reader, java.util.List<BsonElement> extraElements)
      Reads a single document from the given BsonReader and writes it to this, appending the given extra elements to the document.
      void BsonBinaryWriter.pipe​(BsonReader reader)  
      void BsonBinaryWriter.pipe​(BsonReader reader, java.util.List<BsonElement> extraElements)

    • Uses of BsonReader in org.bson.json

      Classes in org.bson.json that implement BsonReader 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  JsonReader
      Reads a JSON in one of the following modes: Strict mode that conforms to the JSON RFC specifications. JavaScript mode that that most JavaScript interpreters can process Shell mode that the mongo shell can process.
